Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black (only minute traces remaining); exterior: chain of alternating lotus flowers and buds; band below, above tips of rays around foot..
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as being in the style of the Würzburg chalices, but dated later than those chalices because she considers the style of the drawing to be debased and because of the elementary and isolated interior decoration (Lemos 1991, 72-3). However, virtually nothing remains of the decoration on its interior.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 73, p. 251, no. 375)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0185) (phase 2)
